meanings.definition: An event causing great and often sudden damage or suffering.
meanings.sent1: Natural catastrophes like hurricanes can be very destructive.
meanings.sent2: The earthquake was a catastrophic event that left many people homeless.
meanings.sent3: The picnic turned into a catastrophe when it started raining heavily.
meanings.sent4: The financial market crash was a catastrophe for many investors.
meanings.sent5: The tsunami was a catastrophic disaster that changed the coastal landscape forever.

meanings.sent1: The play was a catastrophe with actors forgetting their lines.
meanings.sent2: The project turned into a catastrophe when the main server crashed.
meanings.sent3: The birthday party became a catastrophe when the cake fell on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The business deal was a catastrophe, leading to huge losses.
meanings.sent5: The camping trip was a catastrophic failure due to bad weather and lack of supplies.
